tool_description: Scrape web pages, generate screenshots or turn them into PDF, without worrying about proxy rotation, headless browser management or JavaScript execution.
name: Ujeebu Web Page Scraping
title: Ujeebu Web Page Scraping

api_list.name: /v1.1/scrape
api_list.description: Returns the html source of a rendered web page. Generates PDF or Screenshot of a web page.

optional_parameters.name: response_type
optional_parameters.description:
The response returned by the endpoint depends on the 'response_type' and 'json' parameters. Response can be either a byte array in the case of 'pdf' and 'screenshot', text when response_type='raw' or 'html' (default), or JSON when json=1. response_type possible values are as follows:
- 'html': returns the html code of the page . If js = 1 it will first execute JavaScript.
- 'raw': returns the source html (or file content if URL is not an HTML page) as is from the URL without running JavaScript. js=1 is ignored.
- 'pdf': converts page to the PDF format and returns the PDF binary data.
If the json parameter is set to 'true' a JSON response is returned with the base64 encoded value of the pdf file.
- 'screenshot': produces a screenshot of the URL in PNG format and returns the binary data. If screenshot_fullpage is set to 'true', takes a screenshot of the full page. If set to 'false', takes a screenshot of the visible viewport only. If the json parameter is set to 'true', a JSON response is returned with the base64 encoded value of the image file.

optional_parameters.name: js
optional_parameters.description: indicates whether to execute JavaScript or not. Default =0

optional_parameters.name: block_ads
optional_parameters.description: whether to block ads or not

optional_parameters.name: json
optional_parameters.description: when set to true, returns a JSON response instead of raw content as specified by 'response_type'. Default = 0.

optional_parameters.name: useragent
optional_parameters.description: The Scrape API will by default send its own user agent header (Chrome's headless browser header), but if you want to use a different user agent you need to set parameter 'useragent'
optional_parameters.default: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko

optional_parameters.name: screenshot_fullpage
optional_parameters.description: when 'content_type' is 'screenshot', whether to take a screenshot of the full page or just the visible viewport

optional_parameters.name: device
optional_parameters.description: indicates type of device to use to render page. Possible values: 'desktop', 'mobile'. Default='desktop'
